sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"吃"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: eat, dine, have, consume, devour, gorge, swallow
means: eat ： 普通用词，使用广泛。既可用于人，也可用于动物。
dine ： 正式用词，既可指一日三餐中的任何一餐，也可以指特殊的用餐。
have ： 可与eat换用，但强调一次性的动作。
consume ： 侧重痛痛快快地吃得一干二净，可用于人和动物。
devour ： 指狼吞虎咽地吃，强调吃得既快又彻底。
gorge ： 侧重指拼命地吃或塞，强调吃饱或吃得过量。
swallow ： 主要指吃的整个过程的第二部分"咽"，并常指咀嚼得匆匆忙忙地吃。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"有，具有，持有"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: have, hold, own, possess, keep, enjoy
means: have ： 最常用词，可指任何情况下的具有，无论是物质的或精神的。
hold ： 指拥有并保持财产及持有见解等，暗示不让别人拿走或占有。
own不及本组的possess正式，多指所属关系，强调所有权，不管所属物是否在物主手中。
possess ： 较正式，指拥有或占有并能加以控制与支配，强调其归属；也指具有某种品质、才能、特点或性能等。
keep ： 指长时间地保有，保存某物，防止别人占去，强调安全和感情上的依附。
enjoy ： 指享有某种权利或长处，带有欣赏或喜爱的情感。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使，使得"之意。
means: make ： 普通用词，指强迫或劝诱他人做某事。
cause ： 正式用词，侧重指使某事发生的原因。
get ： 侧重指劝某人做某事，或指使某事物处于某种状态或产生某种结果。
have ： 普通用词，指让某人做某事。
render ： 书面用词，多指因外界因素而使某人或某物处于某种状态。

list.explanation: 非常喜欢某人，狂热地爱上某人

example.en: She has a crush on the new gym mistress.
example.zh: 她非常喜欢新来的女体育老师。

example.en: Hatfmld had it in for McCoy.
example.zh: 哈特菲尔德对麦科伊十分不满。

list.explanation: (对某人)产生强烈的爱或情欲

example.en: I'd never have the deep undying hots for that rah-rah boy.
example.zh: 对那个大学生，我永远也不会有深邃永恒的爱。

slang.tokens: have a bone to pick with

list.explanation: 同…有争端'对…有理由怀恨，抱怨(某人或某嚷物)

example.en: They had a bone to pick with neighbouring villages.
example.zh: 他们与邻村曾布过争端端。

example.en: The ambassador had a bone to pick with the student demonstrations.
example.zh: 大使就学生示威一事提出抗议。

slang.tokens: Do I have to paint (you) a picture. (=Do I have to draw you a picture?)

list.explanation: 你明白没有？要我 给你说明白吗?

example.en: Do I have to draw you a picture or you can visualize this?
example.zh: 这事要我给你说明白呢，还是你自己能想像得出来？

hav拥有+en场所→有[安全]的场所

entry.def: You use the forms have and has with a past participle to form the present perfect tense of verbs.
entry.tran: (have 和 has 与过去分词连用构成动词的现在完成时)

example.ex: Alex has already gone...
example.tran: 亚历克斯已经走了。

example.ex: I've just seen a play that I can highly recommend...
example.tran: 我刚看了一场话剧，我强烈推荐。

entry.def: You use the form had with a past participle to form the past perfect tense of verbs.
entry.tran: (had 与过去分词连用构成动词的过去完成时)

example.ex: When I met her, she had just returned from a job interview...
example.tran: 我遇见她时，她刚参加完一场求职面试回来。

example.ex: By Friday at 5:30 p.m., I still hadn't heard from Lund...
example.tran: 直到周五下午5点半，我仍未收到伦德的消息。

entry.def: Have is used in question tags.

example.ex: You haven't sent her away, have you?...
example.tran: 你还没有把她送走，是吗？

example.ex: It's happened, hasn't it?...
example.tran: 这事儿已经发生了，是吗？

entry.def: You use have when you are confirming or contradicting a statement containing 'have', 'has', or 'had', or answering a question.
entry.tran: (用于对带有 have,has 或 had 的句子作肯定或否定回答)

example.ex: 'You'd never seen the Marilyn Monroe film?' — 'No I hadn't.'...
example.tran: “你从未看过玛丽莲·梦露的电影？”“对，没有。”

example.ex: 'Have you been to York before?' — 'Yes we have.'
example.tran: “你们以前去过约克吗？”“是的，去过。”

entry.def: The form having with a past participle can be used to introduce a clause in which you mention an action which had already happened before another action began.
entry.tran: （having 和过去分词连用，所引导的分句中提到的动作发生在另一个动作开始之前）

example.ex: He arrived in San Francisco, having left New Jersey on January 19th...
example.tran: 1月19日离开新泽西后，他到了旧金山。

example.ex: Having been told by his doctor that he was overweight, he's eating all the fibre and fruit he can.
example.tran: 被医生告知超重后，他一直拼命地吃高纤维食物和水果。

usage_note.note: In spoken English, forms of have are often shortened, for example I have is shortened to I've and has not is shortened to hasn't.
usage_note.translation: 在英语口语中 have 经常用缩略形式，如 I have 略作 I've，has not 略作 hasn't。

entry.def: You can use have followed by a noun to talk about an action or event, when it would be possible to use the same word as a verb. For example, you can say 'I had a look at the photos' instead of 'I looked at the photos.'
entry.tran: （have 后接名词代替该名词作动词的用法，描述某一动作或事件）

example.ex: I went out and had a walk around...
example.tran: 我出去在周围散了一会儿步。

example.ex: She rested for a while, then had a wash and changed her clothes...
example.tran: 她休息了一会儿，然后洗了洗，换了身衣服。

entry.def: In normal spoken or written English, people use have with a wide range of nouns to talk about actions and events, often instead of a more specific verb. For example people are more likely to say 'we had ice cream' or 'he's had a shock' than 'we ate ice cream', or 'he's suffered a shock'.
entry.tran: （在英语口语或书面语中，have可以和很多名词连用以代替某个具体的动词，描述某一动作或事件）

example.ex: Come and have a meal with us tonight...
example.tran: 今晚来和我们一起吃饭吧。

example.ex: We will be having a meeting to decide what to do...
example.tran: 我们准备开个会来决定怎么办。

collins.tran: 与描述动作的名词连用

usage_note.note: Have is used in combination with a wide range of nouns, where the meaning of the combination is mostly given by the noun.
usage_note.translation: have 可以和很多名词连用，其意思主要由名词决定。

entry.def: You use have to say that someone or something owns a particular thing, or when you are mentioning one of their qualities or characteristics.

example.ex: Oscar had a new bicycle...
example.tran: 奥斯卡有一辆新自行车。

example.ex: I want to have my own business...
example.tran: 我想自己创业。

entry.def: If you have something to do, you are responsible for doing it or must do it.

example.ex: He had plenty of work to do...
example.tran: 他有很多工作要做。

example.ex: I have some important calls to make.
example.tran: 我要打几个重要的电话。

entry.def: You can use have instead of 'there is' to say that something exists or happens. For example, you can say 'you have no alternative' instead of 'there is no alternative', or 'he had a good view from his window' instead of 'there was a good view from his window'.
entry.tran: （用于代替 there is, 表示某事物存在或发生了某事）

example.ex: He had two tenants living with him...
example.tran: 有两位房客和他同住。

example.ex: We haven't any shops on the island...
example.tran: 我们岛上什么店铺都没有。

entry.def: If you have something such as a part of your body in a particular position or state, it is in that position or state.

example.ex: Mary had her eyes closed...
example.tran: 玛丽双目紧闭。

example.ex: They had the curtains open...
example.tran: 他们开着窗帘。

entry.def: If you have something done, someone does it for you or you arrange for it to be done.

example.ex: I had your rooms cleaned and aired...
example.tran: 我请人打扫了你的房间并通了风。

example.ex: They had him killed...
example.tran: 他们派人干掉了他。

entry.def: If someone has something unpleasant happen to them, it happens to them.

example.ex: We had our money stolen...
example.tran: 我们的钱被偷了。

example.ex: The dance hall once even had its roof blown off in World War II.
example.tran: 这个舞厅的屋顶甚至在第二次世界大战中被炸飞过。

entry.def: If you have someone do something, you persuade, cause, or order them to do it.

example.ex: If you happen to talk to him, have him call me...
example.tran: 如果你碰巧能和他说话，让他给我打个电话。

example.ex: The bridge is not as impressive as some guides would have you believe...
example.tran: 这座大桥并不像有些导游说的那么雄伟。

entry.def: If someone has you by a part of your body, they are holding you there and they are trying to hurt you or force you to go somewhere.
entry.tran: 抓住（某人身体的某部位）

example.ex: When the police came, Larry had him by the ear and was beating his head against the pavement.
example.tran: 警方赶到时，拉里正揪着他的耳朵，把他的头往人行道上撞。

entry.def: If you have something from someone, they give it to you.

example.ex: You can have my ticket...
example.tran: 我可以把我的票给你。

example.ex: Can I have your name please?...
example.tran: 请告诉我你的名字好吗？

entry.def: If you have an illness or disability, you suffer from it.

example.ex: I had a headache...
example.tran: 我头疼。

example.ex: He might be having a heart attack...
example.tran: 他可能是心脏病发作。

entry.def: If a woman has a baby, she gives birth to it. If she is having a baby, she is pregnant.

example.ex: My wife has just had a baby boy...
example.tran: 我妻子刚生了个男孩。

example.ex: She's having another baby.
example.tran: 她又怀上孩子了。

entry.def: You can use have in expressions such as 'I won't have it' or 'I'm not having that', to mean that you will not allow or put up with something.

example.ex: She wanted to be alone. They wouldn't have it...
example.tran: 她想一个人呆着。他们不允许。

example.ex: I'm not having any of that nonsense...
example.tran: 我不想听那些废话。

entry.def: You can use has it in expressions such as 'rumour has it that' or 'as legend has it' when you are quoting something that you have heard, but you do not necessarily think it is true.

example.ex: Rumour has it that tickets were being sold for £300...
example.tran: 据谣传，票卖到了300英镑。

example.ex: He could not possibly have been poisoned as popular legend has it.
example.tran: 他不可能像民间传说的那样被下了毒。

entry.def: If someone has it in for you, they do not like you and they want to make life difficult for you.
entry.tran: 跟…过不去;总想找…的茬儿

example.ex: He's always had it in for the Dawkins family.
example.tran: 他老是跟道金斯一家过不去。

entry.def: If you have it in you, you have abilities and skills which you do not usually use and which only show themselves in a difficult situation.

example.ex: 'You were brilliant!' he said. 'I didn't know you had it in you.'
example.tran: “你真厉害！”他说，“我不知道你还有这两下子。”

example.ex: He has it in him to succeed.
example.tran: 他具备成功的潜质。

entry.def: To have it off with someone or have it away with someone means to have sex with them.

example.ex: He reckons she's having it off with the gardener.
example.tran: 他认为她和园丁有一腿。

entry.def: If you are having someone on, you are pretending that something is true when it is not true, for example as a joke or in order to tease them.

example.ex: Malone's eyes widened. 'You're having me on, Liam.'
example.tran: 马隆瞪大了双眼。“你在戏弄我吧，利亚姆。”

entry.def: If you have it out or have things out with someone, you discuss a problem or disagreement very openly with them, even if it means having an argument, because you think this is the best way to solve the problem.
entry.tran: 和…讲个明白;和…争论出个结果

example.ex: Why not have it out with your critic, discuss the whole thing face to face?
example.tran: 为什么不和批评你的人讲个明白，面对面地把整件事情谈一谈呢？

usage_note.note: For meanings 1-4, people often use have got in spoken British English or have gotten in spoken American English, instead of have. In this case, have is pronounced as an auxiliary verb. For more information and examples of the use of ‘have got’ and ‘have gotten’, see got.
usage_note.translation: 在义项1-4中，英国英语口语中常用 have got 代替 have，美国英语口语中则常用 have gotten。这时，have 的发音与作助动词时相同。有关 have got 和 have gotten 的用法详情和例证见 got。

entry.def: You use have to when you are saying that something is necessary or required, or must happen. If you do not have to do something, it is not necessary or required.

example.ex: He had to go to Germany...
example.tran: 他不得不去德国。

example.ex: We'll have to find a taxi...
example.tran: 我们需要找辆出租车。

entry.def: You can use have to in order to say that you feel certain that something is true or will happen.

example.ex: There has to be some kind of way out...
example.tran: 一定会有某种解决办法的。

example.ex: That has to be the biggest lie ever told.
example.tran: 那肯定是有史以来最大的谎言。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who possesses great material wealth
1. have or possess, either in a concrete or an abstract sense;

sentences.sentence: "She holds a Master's degree from Harvard"
"This restaurant features the most famous chefs in France"

means.word_mean: 3. of mental or physical states or experiences;
5. cause to move; cause to be in a certain position or condition;

sentences.sentence: "He got his squad on the ball"
"This let me in for a big surprise"

means.word_mean: 6. serve oneself to, or consume regularly;

sentences.sentence: "I don't take sugar in my coffee"

means.word_mean: 7. have a personal or business relationship with someone;

sentences.sentence: "They have two more years before they retire"

means.word_mean: 13. cause to do; cause to act in a specified manner;

sentences.sentence: "The ads induced me to buy a VCR"
"My children finally got me to buy a computer"
"My wife made me buy a new sofa"

means.word_mean: 14. receive willingly something given or offered;

sentences.sentence: "The only girl who would have him was the miller's daughter"
"I won't have this dog in my house!"

means.word_mean: 15. get something; come into possession of;

sentences.sentence: "She suffered a fracture in the accident"
"He had an insulin shock after eating three candy bars"
"She got a bruise on her leg"
"He got his arm broken in the scuffle"
"He had taken this woman when she was most vulnerable"
